data.question: What is the empirical formula of (O2H3)Sc-MOF?
Which compound has a higher formation energy, (O2H3)Sc-MOF or (μ-OH)3Sc-MOF?
data.answer: (μ-OH)3Sc-MOF has a higher formation energy than (O2H3)Sc-MOF.

data.question: Is (O2H3)Sc-MOF the first example of a MOF material that contains the μ-H3O2– bridging ligand?
What is the space group of (phen)Sc-MOF?
Does the (O2H3)Sc-MOF show higher catalytic activity for cyanosilylation reactions compared to (μ-OH)6Sc-MOF and (Phen)Sc-MOF?
What is the final decomposition product of (phen)Sc-MOF after thermal analysis?
Can the catalysts (O2H3)Sc-MOF, (μ-OH)6Sc-MOF, and (Phen)Sc-MOF be reused without a significant loss in their high catalytic performance?
What is the coordination environment of Sc1 in (O2H3)Sc-MOF?
data.answer: Sc1 is coordinated to two oxygen atoms of sulfonate groups, one oxygen atom of carboxylate group, one hydroxyl anion, one water molecule, and one symmetric [H3O2]– aqua-hydroxo anion.

data.question: Does the synthesis condition pH > 4 lead to the formation of ScO(OH) in the Sc-(3,5-DSB) system?
What is the point (Schläfli) symbol of the 2D binodal 3,6-connected plane net of the kgd type assigned to (O2H3)Sc-MOF?
Is the (μ-OH)3Sc-MOF obtained as a pure phase under the synthesis conditions?
What is the role of the ligand in the formation of the 3D network of (μ-OH)6Sc-MOF?
data.answer: The ligand coordinates through the carboxylate group in an η2,μ2 mode, and through the sulfonate groups in an η1-anti mode and an η2,μ2-anti-anti mode, acting as a pillar that gives rise to the 3D net.

data.question: Does the (O2H3)Sc-MOF contain the μ-H3O2– bridging ligand based on crystallographic data?
What is the crystal system of (μ-OH)6Sc-MOF?
Is the formation of (O2H3)Sc-MOF from (μ-OH)3Sc-MOF a thermodynamically governed process?
What is the main product of the cyanosilylation reaction catalyzed by (O2H3)Sc-MOF at 40 °C with 5 mol% of catalyst and ethanol as solvent?
Does the (O2H3)Sc-MOF undergo decomposition to give Sc2O3 at temperatures above 520 °C?
What is the coordination mode of the sulfonate groups in (O2H3)Sc-MOF?
data.answer: Bridged bidentate coordination mode (η2μ2) and unidentate mode (η1)

data.question: Is the (O2H3)Sc-MOF stable after catalytic studies?
What is the role of the hydrogen bonds in the formation of the 3D supramolecular net of (O2H3)Sc-MOF?
data.answer: The hydrogen bonds connect the layers via coordinated water molecules and sulfonate oxygen atoms, giving rise to a three-dimensional supramolecular net.
